page.title: 01Description of the block
page.content: Residential development dominates the block. Older terraced houses are characteristic of the northern border as it fringes onto St.Helens, but the bulk of Rainhill comprises post-war, speculatively-built detatched and semi -detatched houses, some very expensive indeed. Grain farming dominates the farming areas with some grasses. Rainhill is dormitory to the surrounding urban centres, the M62 Motorway encouraging commuting as far as Manchester. Some light manufacturing is appearing on a newly developed estate on old waste lands to the east. Sutton Manor colliery employes few from Rainhill, drawing its miners from St.Helens. A mental hospital and a General Hospital are important local employers
